definition: variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: IN 1887 physicists were feeling pretty smug about their subject.
sentences.chinese: 1887年物理学家们对自己的学科都颇为自鸣得意。

sentences.english: It is already so painful for this monkey.
sentences.chinese: 这实验已经让猴子颇为痛苦了。

sentences.english: Herzog and Simons are optimistic about the prospects for making progress against migraines.
sentences.chinese: 荷佐和赛门斯对于治疗偏头痛的未来进展颇为乐观。

sentences.english: These masquerade balls became popular in continental Europe in the 17th century.
sentences.chinese: 这种化妆舞会在十七世纪的欧陆颇为盛行。

sentences.english: Risk forecast and management is recently an interesting topic in the field of aids to navigation.
sentences.chinese: 风险预测及管理是国示航标界近年来颇为关注的话题。

sentences.english: Early accurate diagnosis and prompt treatment are needed.
sentences.chinese: 本病的的早期正确诊断颇为重要。

sentences.english: It is hard for "an iceberg to melt overnight", says one.
sentences.chinese: 其中一人表示“三尺之冰一夜而泮”颇为困难。

sentences.english: Only on hearing this did he change his mind. This unpleasant event made me quite unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 这次大煞风景的导游，令我颇为不快。

sentences.english: This new drink tastes much the same as orange juice.
sentences.chinese: 这种新饮料喝起来跟柳橙汁颇为相似。

sentences.english: Wuli only long tea house on the Street has more than ten business is booming.
sentences.chinese: 仅五里长的老街上茶馆就有十多家，生意颇为兴隆。

sentences.english: Following these rhymes, comes that valuable section of prose material which is generally called experience stories.
sentences.chinese: 韵语之后，是颇为可观的散文部分“生活故事”。

sentences.english: Once we were out of the house, he seemed more in his own element.
sentences.chinese: 我们一离开家，他看上去就颇为得意。

sentences.english: Beautifully balanced with red fruit and plum flavors followed by a wood sensation.
sentences.chinese: 红果与李子的口味在橡木味道衬托下颇为平衡。

sentences.english: For decades, Whorf's theory dazzled both academics and the general public alike.
sentences.chinese: 数十年来，沃尔夫的理论让学界和大众颇为不解。

sentences.english: I am a good accountant and have a thorough knowledge of the English language.
sentences.chinese: 我是一个优秀的会计员，同时深信对英文颇为熟练。

sentences.english: Tang Xianzu is a high-yield writer, his poetry and drama writings is abundant.
sentences.chinese: 汤显祖是一个高产作家，他的诗歌戏剧创作颇为丰富。

definition: very/completely/utterly/extremely/absolutely/hundred percent/to divide into ten equal parts
